newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bremen coffee market quiet, Brazil sellers keen.
newsitem.headline: Bremen coffee market quiet, Brazil sellers keen.

text.p: Brazilian sellers are trying to place coffee in the Bremen market, where consumers remain sidelined, traders said on Friday.
Favourable Brazilian differentials failed to lure roasters, who are reasonably well covered for the summer.
The industry noted the latest retail price hike announcement for an average rise by 1.50 marks per 500 gram at Bremen-based Eduscho, which will come into effect on May 26.
Arabica futures were taking a breather after two sessions of sharp gains. New York showed nearby losses at midday.
Cash arabicas (50 kg fob) were $7 up to $5 down this week.
